page.title: 14Chapels & Pubs in Pontycymer
page.content: Main roads in South Wales valleys have their chapels, clubs, Pubs. Oxford street in Pontycymer is no exception. Built of locally quaried Pennant stone, the chapels built to accomodate hundreds in days of revival remian as religious havens for the faithful few that get fewer each year. Mount zion, Noddfa , and Carmel now serve as reminders of a time when sunday was a day of rest and worship. Drinking beer has always accompanied heavy manual work and despite depression, strikes, redundancy and unemployment, the pubs and clubs flourish. Sunday opening of pubs, seen by some as another threat to the traditional Welsh Sunday, was only agreed in 1960's.
